metadata.Title: CVE-2020-4032 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In FreeRDP before version 2.1.2, there is an integer casting vulnerability in update_recv_secondary_order. All clients with +glyph-cache /relax-order-checks are affected. This is fixed in version 2.1.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-4032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
